election_record.label: Kentucky 1820 U.S. Senate, Special, Ballot 3

overview.note: "The two houses then proceeded to the election of a Senator in Congress to supply the vacancy occasioned by the resignation of William Logan, Esq." Argus of Western America (Frankfort, KY). October 26, 1820.
"The joint vote of both houses for Senator to fill the place of Willima Logan." Argus of Western America (Frankfort, KY). October 26, 1820.

"...on the third [ballot] the votes stood thus: For Isham Talbott - Mr. Speaker, Messrs. Allen, Anderson, Blakely, Boyd, Bray, Butler, Chrisholm, S. D. Clark, Cockerill, Cravens, Crow, Farrow, Fletcher, French, Gaines, Garrard, Gerard, Geohegan, Gordon, Harris, Henderson, Hickman, Howard, Hughes, Hunter, Lacey, Lee, Miller, H.W. Moore, Mosely, Mullens, M'Millan, O'Bannon, Parker, J. Patterson, Patton, Phillips, N.P. Porter, O.C. Porter, Prewitt, Roberts, Rudd, Ruffin, Sandford, Stevenson, Taylor, Todd, Townsend, Warfield, Williams and Winlock - 52. For John Rowan - Messrs. Barnett, Bedinger, Berry, Brents, Bullitt, Caldwell, Calhoun, Cassidy, J. Clarke, Cooper, Cotton, Craig, Cunningham, Emerson, Ferguson, Green, Grundy, Hall, King, Lancaster, Love, Lynch, Lyne, T. P. Moore, Munford, Murray, M'Afee, M'Elroy, M'Kee, Noland, W. Patterson, Payne, Rife, Scott, Shelby, Shacklett, Shannon, Sharp, Slaughter, Spillman, Stone, Wakefield, Watkins, Wickliffe, Wilcoxson and Woods - 46." Kentucky Reporter (Lexington, KY). October 30, 1820.

election_record.reference: Argus of Western America (Frankfort, KY). October 26, 1820.
Election of United States Senators by the General Assembly (typed manuscript). Kentucky Historical Society, Frankfort.
